TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract Shape

Docs.summary: Represents an object in the drawing layer, such as an AutoShape, freeform, OLE object, ActiveX control, or picture.

remarks.para: The object is a member of the collection, which includes all the shapes in the main story of a document or in all the headers and footers of a document.
A shape is always attached to an anchoring range. You can position the shape anywhere on the page that contains the anchor.

There are three objects that represent shapes: the collection, which represents all the shapes on a document; the collection, which represents a specified subset of the shapes on a document (for example, a object could represent shapes one and four on the document, or it could represent all the selected shapes on the document); the object, which represents a single shape on a document. If you want to work with several shapes at the same time or with shapes within the selection, use a collection.
Use Shapes(), where is the name or the index number, to return a single object.

Each shape is assigned a default name when it is created. For example, if you add three different shapes to a document, they might be named "Rectangle 2," "TextBox 3," and "Oval 4." To give a shape a more meaningful name, set the property.
Use Selection.ShapeRange(), where is the name or the index number, to return a object that represents a shape within a selection.

To add a object to the collection of shapes for the specified document and return a object that represents the newly created shape, use one of the following methods of the collection: , , , , , , , , , , or .
Use GroupItems(), where is the shape name or the index number within the group, to return a Shape object that represents a single shape in a grouped shape.

Use the or method to group a range of shapes and return a single object that represents the newly formed group. After a group has been formed, you can work with the group the same way you work with any other shape.

Every object is anchored to a range of text. A shape is anchored to the beginning of the first paragraph that contains the anchoring range. The shape will always remain on the same page as its anchor.

You can view the anchor itself by setting the property to True. The shape's and properties determine its vertical and horizontal positions. The shape's and properties determine whether the position is measured from the anchoring paragraph, the column that contains the anchoring paragraph, the margin, or the edge of the page.
If the property for the shape is set to True, you cannot drag the anchor from its position on the page.

Use the property to return the object, which contains all the properties and methods for formatting the fill of a closed shape. The property returns the object, which you use to format a shadow. Use the property to return the object, which contains properties and methods for formatting lines and arrows. The property returns the object, which you use to format WordArt. The property returns the object, which you use to format line callouts. The property returns the object, which you use to define how text wraps around shapes. The property returns the object, which you use to create 3-D shapes. You can use the and methods to transfer formatting from one shape to another.
Use the method for a object to set the formatting for the default shape for the document. New shapes inherit many of their attributes from the default shape.

Use the property to specify the type of shape: freeform, AutoShape, OLE object, callout, or linked picture, for instance. Use the property to specify the type of AutoShape: oval, rectangle, or balloon, for instance.
Use the and properties to specify the size of the shape.
The property returns the object, which contains all the properties and methods for attaching text to shapes and linking the text between text frames.

objects are anchored to a range of text but are free-floating and can be positioned anywhere on the page. objects are treated like characters and are positioned as characters within a line of text. You can use the method and the method to convert shapes from one type to the other. You can convert only pictures, OLE objects, and ActiveX controls to inline shapes.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Activate() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Activates the specified object.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Adjustments As Adjustments

Docs.summary: Returns a object that contains adjustment values for all the adjustments in the specified object that represents an AutoShape or WordArt.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ AlternativeText { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.AlternativeText : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the alternative text associated with a shape in a Web page.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Anchor As Range
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Range ^ Anchor { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Range ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the anchoring range for the specified shape.
Docs.value: All objects are anchored to a range of text but can be positioned anywhere on the page that contains the anchor. If you specify the anchoring range when you create a shape, the anchor is positioned at the beginning of the first paragraph that contains the anchoring range. If you don't specify the anchoring range, the anchoring range is selected automatically and the shape is positioned relative to the top and left edges of the page.The shape will always remain on the same page as its anchor. If the property for the shape is set to True, you cannot drag the anchor from its position on the page.

public: property int AnchorID { int get(); };

Docs.summary: To be added.

remarks.para: If formatting for the object has not previously been copied using the method, using the method generates an error.

remarks.para: When you change the type of a shape, the shape retains its size, color, and other attributes.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CanvasCropBottom([in]float32 Increment) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required Single. The amount in percentage points of a drawing canvas's height that you want remaining after the canvas is cropped. Entering 0.9 as the increment crops ten percent of the canvas's height from the bottom. Entering 0.1 crops ninety percent of the canvas's height from the bottom.
Docs.summary: Crops a percentage of the height of a drawing canvas from the bottom of the canvas.

remarks.para: Use the method to crop from the top.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CanvasCropLeft([in]float32 Increment) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required Single. The amount in percentage points of the drawing canvas's width that you want remaining after the canvas is cropped. Entering 0.9 as the increment crops ten percent of the canvas's width from the left. Entering 0.1 crops ninety percent of the canvas's width from the left.
Docs.summary: Crops a percentage of the width of a drawing canvas from the left side of the canvas.

remarks.para: Use the method to crop from the right side of a drawing canvas.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CanvasCropRight([in]float32 Increment) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required Single. The amount in percentage points of the canvas's width that you want remaining after the canvas is cropped. Entering 0.9 as the increment crops ten percent of the canvas's width from the right. Entering 0.1 crops ninety percent of the canvas's width from the right.
Docs.summary: Crops a percentage of the width of a drawing canvas from the right side of the canvas.

remarks.para: Use the method to crop from the left side of a drawing canvas.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CanvasCropTop([in]float32 Increment) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required Single. The amount in percentage points of a canvas's height that you want remaining after the canvas is cropped. Entering 0.9 as the increment crops ten percent of the canvas's height from the top. Entering 0.1 crops ninety percent of the canvas's height from the top.
Docs.summary: Crops a percentage of the height of a drawing canvas from the top of the canvas.

remarks.para: Use the method to crop from the bottom.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Frame ConvertToFrame() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Converts the specified shape to a frame.

remarks.para: This property returns a object that represents the new frame.
Shapes that don't support attached text cannot be converted to frames. For pictures, OLE objects, and ActiveX controls, use the method.
In Microsoft Word 97 and later, frames have been replaced by text boxes.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.InlineShape ConvertToInlineShape() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Converts the specified shape in the drawing layer of a document to an inline shape in the text layer.

remarks.para: You can convert only shapes that represent pictures, OLE objects, or ActiveX controls. This method returns an object that represents the picture or OLE object.
Shapes that support attached text cannot be converted to inline shapes. For these shapes, use the method.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Creator As Integer
public: property int Creator { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which the specified object was created.

remarks.para: If the specified object was created in Microsoft Word, this property returns the hexadecimal number 4D535744, which represents the string "MSWD." This value can also be represented by the constant wdCreatorCode.

The Creator property was primarily designed to be used on the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Word has the creator code MSWD. For additional information about this property, consult the language reference Help included with Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void IncrementLeft([in]float32 Increment) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required Single. Specifies how far the shape is to be moved horizontally, in points. A positive value moves the shape to the right; a negative value moves it to the left.
Docs.summary: Moves the specified shape horizontally by the specified number of points.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void IncrementRotation([in]float32 Increment) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required Single. Specifies how far the shape is to be rotated horizontally, in degrees. A positive value rotates the shape clockwise; a negative value rotates it counterclockwise.
Docs.summary: Changes the rotation of the specified shape around the z-axis by the specified number of degrees.

remarks.para: Use the property to set the absolute rotation of the shape.
To rotate a three-dimensional shape around the x-axis or the y-axis, use the method or the method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void IncrementTop([in]float32 Increment) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required Single. Specifies how far the shape object is to be moved vertically, in points. A positive value moves the shape down; a negative value moves it up.
Docs.summary: Moves the specified shape vertically by the specified number of points.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int LayoutInCell { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.LayoutInCell : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns an Integer that represents whether a shape in a table is displayed inside the table or outside of the table.

remarks.para: This property returns True to indicate that a specified picture is displayed within the table, and False to indicate that a specified picture is displayed outside of the table.
Setting the LayoutInCell property will take effect only if the property of the object is set to something other than wdWrapTypeInline or wdWrapTypeNone.
The LayoutInCell property corresponds to the Layout in table cell option in the Advanced Layout dialog box for picture formatting.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float Left { float get(); void set(float value); };
member this.Left : single with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Single that represents the horizontal position, measured in points, of the specified shape or shape range.

remarks.para: This property returns any valid constant.

The position of a shape is measured from the upper-left corner of the shape's bounding box to the shape's anchor. The property controls whether the anchor is positioned alongside a character, column, margin, or the edge of the page.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float LeftRelative { float get(); void set(float value); };
member this.LeftRelative : single with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Single that represents the relative left position of a shape. Read/write.

remarks.para: Use this property with the property. When set to wdShapePositionRelativeNone (-999999) (see the enumeration), this property should be ignored because the shape does not use percent positioning. The horizontal position is solely determined by the property.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Line As LineFormat

Docs.summary: Returns a object that contains line formatting properties for the specified shape.

remarks.para: For a line, the LineFormat object represents the line itself; for a shape with a border, the LineFormat object represents the border.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property LinkFormat As LinkFormat

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the link options of the specified shape that's linked to a file.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int LockAnchor { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.LockAnchor : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if the specified object's anchor is locked to the anchoring range.

remarks.para: This property returns true if the specified object's anchor is locked to the anchoring range. When a shape has a locked anchor, you cannot move the shape's anchor by dragging it (the anchor doesn't move as the shape is moved).

A Shape object is anchored to a range of text, but you can position it anywhere on the page. The shape is anchored to the beginning of the first paragraph that contains the anchoring range. A shape will always remain on the same page as its anchor.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoTriState LockAspectRatio { Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoTriState get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoTriState value); };
member this.LockAspectRatio : Microsoft.Office.Core.MsoTriState with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if you can change the height and width of the shape independently of one another when you resize it or if it retains its original proportions.

remarks.para: This property returns MsoTrue if the specified shape retains its original proportions when you resize it, and MsoFalse if you can change the height and width of the shape independently of one another when you resize it.

MemberSignature.Value: public void ScaleHeight (float Factor, Microsoft.Office.Core.MsoTriState RelativeToOriginalSize, Microsoft.Office.Core.MsoScaleFrom Scale = Microsoft.Office.Core.MsoScaleFrom.msoScaleFromTopLeft);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ScaleHeight([in]float32 Factor, [in]valuetype Microsoft.Office.Core.MsoTriState RelativeToOriginalSize, [in]valuetype Microsoft.Office.Core.MsoScaleFrom Scale) runtime managed
Public Sub ScaleHeight (Factor As Single, RelativeToOriginalSize As MsoTriState, Optional Scale As MsoScaleFrom = Microsoft.Office.Core.MsoScaleFrom.msoScaleFromTopLeft)
abstract member ScaleHeight : single * Microsoft.Office.Core.MsoTriState * Microsoft.Office.Core.MsoScaleFrom -> unit

Docs.param: Required Single. Specifies the ratio between the height of the shape after you resize it and the current or original height. For example, to make a rectangle 50 percent larger, specify 1.5 for this argument.

Required . True to scale the shape relative to its original size. False to scale it relative to its current size. You can specify True for this argument only if the specified shape is a picture or an OLE object.
Optional . The part of the shape that retains its position when the shape is scaled.
Docs.summary: Scales the height of the shape by a specified factor.

remarks.para: For pictures and OLE objects, you can indicate whether you want to scale the shape relative to the original size or relative to the current size. Shapes other than pictures and OLE objects are always scaled relative to their current height.

MemberSignature.Value: public void ScaleWidth (float Factor, Microsoft.Office.Core.MsoTriState RelativeToOriginalSize, Microsoft.Office.Core.MsoScaleFrom Scale = Microsoft.Office.Core.MsoScaleFrom.msoScaleFromTopLeft);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ScaleWidth([in]float32 Factor, [in]valuetype Microsoft.Office.Core.MsoTriState RelativeToOriginalSize, [in]valuetype Microsoft.Office.Core.MsoScaleFrom Scale) runtime managed
Public Sub ScaleWidth (Factor As Single, RelativeToOriginalSize As MsoTriState, Optional Scale As MsoScaleFrom = Microsoft.Office.Core.MsoScaleFrom.msoScaleFromTopLeft)
abstract member ScaleWidth : single * Microsoft.Office.Core.MsoTriState * Microsoft.Office.Core.MsoScaleFrom -> unit

Docs.param: Required Single. Specifies the ratio between the width of the shape after you resize it and the current or original width. For example, to make a rectangle 50 percent larger, specify 1.5 for this argument.

Required . True to scale the shape relative to its original size. False to scale it relative to its current size. You can specify True for this argument only if the specified shape is a picture or an OLE object.
Optional . The part of the shape that retains its position when the shape is scaled.
Docs.summary: Scales the width of the shape by a specified factor.

remarks.para: For pictures and OLE objects, you can indicate whether you want to scale the shape relative to the original size or relative to the current size. Shapes other than pictures and OLE objects are always scaled relative to their current width.

remarks.para: Read/write. Use this property to provide an alternative text title for a shape. This property adds title text to the Title text box on the Alt Text pane of the Format Shape dialog in Microsoft Word 2010.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float Top { float get(); void set(float value); };
member this.Top : single with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the vertical position of the specified shape in points.

remarks.para: The position of a shape is measured from the upper-left corner of the shape's bounding box to the shape's anchor. The property controls whether the shape's anchor is positioned alongside the line, the paragraph, the margin, or the edge of the page.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float TopRelative { float get(); void set(float value); };
member this.TopRelative : single with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Single that represents the relative top position of a shape. Read/write.

remarks.para: Use this property with the property. When set to wdShapePositionRelativeNone (-999999) (see the enumeration), this property should be ignored because the shape does not use percent positioning. The vertical position is solely determined by the property.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Type As MsoShapeType
public: property Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoShapeType Type { Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoShapeType get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the shape type.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.ShapeRange Ungroup() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Ungroups any grouped shapes in the specified shape.

remarks.para: Disassembles pictures and OLE objects within the specified shape.
Returns the ungrouped shapes as a single object.

Because a group of shapes is treated as a single object, grouping and ungrouping shapes changes the number of items in the collection and changes the index numbers of items that come after the affected items in the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property VerticalFlip As MsoTriState
public: property Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoTriState VerticalFlip { Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoTriState get(); };

Docs.summary: Determines if the specified shape is flipped around the vertical axis.

remarks.para: This property returns True if the specified shape is flipped around the vertical axis, and False if not.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Vertices As Object
public: property System::Object ^ Vertices { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the coordinates of the specified freeform drawing's vertices (and control points for Bézier curves) as a series of coordinate pairs.

remarks.para: You can use the array returned by this property as an argument for the or method.
The following table shows how the Vertices property associates values in the array vertArray() with the coordinates of a triangle's vertices.

item.description: The horizontal distance from the first vertex to the left side of the document.
The vertical distance from the first vertex to the top of the document.
The horizontal distance from the second vertex to the left side of the document.
The vertical distance from the second vertex to the top of the document.
The horizontal distance from the third vertex to the left side of the document.
The vertical distance from the third vertex to the top of the document.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoTriState Visible { Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoTriState get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoTriState value); };
member this.Visible : Microsoft.Office.Core.MsoTriState with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if the specified object, or the formatting applied to it, is visible.

remarks.para: This property returns True if the specified object, or the formatting applied to it, is visible, and False if it is not.
For any object, some methods and properties may be unavailable if the Visible property is False.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float Width { float get(); void set(float value); };
member this.Width : single with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the width of the specified object, in points.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float WidthRelative { float get(); void set(float value); };
member this.WidthRelative : single with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Single that represents the relative width of a shape. Read/write.

remarks.para: Use this property with the property. When set to wdShapeSizeRelativeNone (-999999) (see the enumeration), this property should be ignored because the shape does not use percent sizing. The width is solely determined by the property.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property WrapFormat As WrapFormat

Docs.summary: Returns a object that contains the properties for wrapping text around the specified shape.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ZOrder([in]valuetype Microsoft.Office.Core.MsoZOrderCmd ZOrderCmd) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required . Specifies where to move the specified shape relative to the other shapes.
Docs.summary: Moves the specified shape in front of or behind other shapes in the collection (that is, changes the shape's position in the z-order).

remarks.para: Use the property to determine a shape's current position in the z-order.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ZOrderPosition As Integer
public: property int ZOrderPosition { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the position of the specified shape in the z-order.

remarks.para: To set the shape's position in the z-order, use the method.
A shape's position in the z-order corresponds to the shape's index number in the collection.
Whenever you add a new shape to a collection, it's added to the front of the z-order by default.
